#Text=Davis further stated to the New York Daily News that ( separate from the earlier intimations from the lawyer for Tom Cruise ) the Scientology organization was itself " preparing a lawsuit " against you because of the " disgusting allegations " in the book .

4-42	253-254

column1: #Text=Have you received any notice from the Scientology organization with regards such a potential lawsuit ?
#Text=AS
#Text=: No and I do n't expect to .
#Text=Everything I 've stated in my book are things that I personally observed ( and where that was n't the case , I make it clear ) .
#Text=I was careful not to exaggerate , but to be as factual as possible about my experiences .
#Text=There is so much more I could have said about severe abuse others witnessed and told me about , but I kept it to my story .

#Text=As there are numerous witnesses now out of Scientology who also saw what I saw while working at the International Headquarters for Scientology , I do not think Miscavige and his attorneys would be very successful trying to prove my " defamation " and their innocence in front of a jury .
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=Davis proceeded to make claims to the New York Daily News about your sexual relationships .

#Text=Additionally , BBC News reported that after you began to make public criticism of the organization and its leader David Miscavige , Scientology provided " intimate details of her sex life " to the Florida newspaper the St. Petersburg Times .

column1: #Text=How did you feel when these sexual details were made public by Scientology ?

#Text=How do you feel this behavior by the organization and its officials reflects on its assertions of keeping confidential information secret , and respecting the privacy of priest-penitent privilege ?
#Text=AS
#Text=: To me – and MANY other people – it was obvious through their child-like reaction that they have something fairly big to hide .
#Text=I gave a detailed eye-witness account of the head of the Scientology religion repeatedly beating staff members .
#Text=That they respond with exaggerated accusations about my sex life is just a red herring .
#Text=And it also proves that private information you may divulge in confessionals while a member of Scientology could be used against you should you step out of line in the future .
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=In an August 2009 issue of the Scientology publication , Freedom Magazine , the issue referred to you multiple times only as " The Adulteress " .
#Text=How did this make you feel when you found out about this publication ?
#Text=When you were still a member of the Scientology organization , what was your opinion at that point in time of Freedom Magazine ?
#Text=What is your opinion of the publication - its reputability and reliability , at this point in time ?
#Text=AS

#Text=: The " Freedom " magazine is the public mouthpiece for Scientology , often used as a medium to expose what they consider to be the ills of society ( psychiatry , pharmaceutical companies and major critics of their religion ) .

#Text=I was not surprised that they put out a magazine against those who exposed the illegal actions of the Scientology leader , David Miscavige , with his repeated abuse and assault and battery being committed on his junior Scientology executives .
#Text=They felt that an attack on Miscavige was an attack on the whole religion and therefore those people involved needed to be exposed as rotten to the core .
